intro: Dimorphanthera crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved dimorphanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
